question: A 21-year-old male is recently diagnosed with osteoblastoma. Which of the following is the most common site of occurrence of osteoblastoma?
A 21-year-old man with signs of urethritis, conjunctivitis, and arthritis has been diagnosed as having a sexually transmitted infection (STI). What is the most likely cause of his disease?
What is the most common hand deformity in rheumatoid arthritis (RA)?
An 8-year-old boy with limbs relatively short when compared with his head is brought into the clinic by his parents. Which of the following cells is defective in this child's condition?
Osteopetrosis is a disorder in which there is failure of normal bone resorption. A defect in which enzyme is responsible for causing this disease?
"Soap bubble" appearance on radiography is typical of which bone tumor?
In which of the following diseases is a mosaic pattern of lamellar and woven bone seen?
Which joint is most commonly involved in pseudogout (calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease)?
Which of the following is true about hyperparathyroidism?

answers.option: Primary hyperparathyroidism is characterized by decreased PTH
Osteitis fibrosa cystica is classically associated with primary hyperparathyroidism
Increased urinary excretion of magnesium is a hallmark
Liver failure is a common cause of secondary hyperparathyroidism
Increased urinary reabsorption of phosphate is seen in primary hyperparathyroidism

question: What is the classical presentation of an osteosarcoma on radiography?
Which of the following diseases may cause hypouricemia?

A 35-year-old female with a known history of inflammatory bowel disease comes to the clinic with the complaint of joint pain in her hands. On examination, the abdomen is tender and oral ulcers are observed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following antibodies are specific for CREST syndrome?
Which of the following is the most common cutaneous manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus?
Which of the following antibodies is specific for polymyositis and dermatomyositis?
Which deformity of the knee is most commonly seen in osteoarthritis?
Which of the following is NOT a predisposing factor for the development of osteoarthritis in the knee?

A 38-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of lower back pain, undocumented weight loss, and mild fever on and off for the last 5 months. Family history is significant for a younger sister diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB), who has not started her prescribed anti-tuberculous therapy yet. On examination, lumbar spine is tender and sensations are reduced in the lower limbs. Which disease is the patient most likely to have?
Which of the following is a malignant tumor that arises from the diaphysis?
Sabre shin is a feature of congenital syphilis. Which part of the tibia is typically affected?
Patients with osteoarthritis may develop bony swellings at the distal interphalangeal (DIP) and proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joints. What are the swellings at DIP joints called?
In patients with osteoarthritis of the knee, the pain usually worsens during which of the following actions?

A 6-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with symmetrical swelling of hand and knee joints for the past 6 days. On examination, the girl has a temperature of 99.8°F with a faint pink rash on the chest, abdomen, and back. The joints are warm and mildly swollen with pain on movement. Which investigation is most appropriate to diagnose the disorder in this girl?

answers.option: No test - clinical diagnosis of exclusion

question: Which investigation is most specific for a diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis?

answers.option: Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and C-reactive protein (CRP)

question: What is the most common ocular complication of ankylosing spondylitis?
Which of the following autoimmune diseases is associated with the highest rate of malignancy?

A 9-month-old boy is brought to the outpatient clinic by his parents with complaint of bilateral knee swelling which started some time after he started to crawl. The parents also recall that he seemed to bleed for a prolonged period following his circumcision. Left knee is tender and swollen with restricted range of motion, while the right knee appears swollen and bruised. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this child?
In osteomyelitis, what is the new bone formed around the infected bone called?
What is the most common cause of primary osteoarthritis?
A 2-year-old boy has presented with multiple fractures and blue sclera. His brother has a similar condition. What is your diagnosis?
X-ray of a 10-year-old boy shows an incidental finding of a central lytic lesion in the upper humerus. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 12-year-old boy comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of pain when opening his mouth and while chewing food. He is diagnosed with sclerosing osteomyelitis of Garré. Which of the following bones is typically involved in this condition?

answers.option: Small bones of hand and feet

question: A 5-year-old girl presents with a vaginal mass. What is the most likely condition?
Anti Jo-1 antibodies are associated with which lung disease?
Which bursa is most likely to get inflammed in house cleaning women?
Which of the following is the most common type of osteogenesis imperfecta?
Which of the following is not a growing end of the bone?
Which of the following is not associated with bone resorption?
A radiologist labels a lesion on an X-ray of the femur as "lytic focus surrounded by a zone of sclerosis". Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Osteoarthritis is what type of joint disease?
Ankylosing Spondylitis most frequently affects which joint?

A 35-year-old patient comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of sudden joint pain and severe tenderness around the joint. He further told the doctor that his joint was swollen, warm to the touch, and skin color changes to red around the joint. Needle aspiration was done and a pseudogout diagnosis was made. Which of the following joint is most likely to involved?

A 22-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of bone pain and a mass around the knee that is increasing in size very rapidly. The biopsy of the mass shows bone formation by tumor cells. Which of the following organs is most likely to be affected first?

A 70-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of pain in the left thigh. Histological evaluation reveals a mosaic pattern of lamellar bone. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the characteristic histological finding found in Paget's disease of bone?
Ewing's sarcoma is a primary malignant bone tumor, what cells does it arise from?
Which of the following is specific for SLE?
A patient presents with lower back pain and uveitis. His X-ray shows a bamboo-like spine. What disease could he possibly have?
Which of the following is the most common type of chondrosarcoma?
Which of the following appears as a stalked tumor of the bone?

A middle-aged man with no known co-morbid came with complaints of severe pain in 1st metatarsophalangeal (MTP) joint. The joint is red, hot, tender, swollen. Which of the following conditions could he most likely have?
Which joint is most commonly involved in pseudogout?
Which of the following antibodies are present in CREST syndrome?
Which of the following statements is true regarding dermatomyositis?

answers.option: Cytotoxic T cells play a major role in pathogenesis
It has a characteristic perioral rash
Tissue biopsy reveals typical inclusion bodies

question: Which of the following is the most common cause of pyogenic osteomyelitis?
Which disease is also called "degenerative joint disease"?
Which of the following is true regarding rheumatoid factor?
What is the correct terminology for fragments of subchondral bone and cartilage in synovial fluid?
Joint mice are present in which of the below enlisted conditions?
Which one of the following is the most common extra-articular manifestation of rheumatoid arthritis?
70-80% of the patients with rheumatoid arthritis are seropositive for which of the following?
What joint is most commonly involved in pseudogout?
Which of the following is the pathognomonic feature of gout?

answers.option: Associated with bony spurs or osteophytes
Secondary form is more common than primary

question: What is the most common bone tumor affecting maxillae and facial bones?
Which histopathological feature is seen with chondrosarcoma?
Which of the following bone pathologies has a characteristic 'onion peel' appearance?
What is the most common primary bone tumor?
Which of these is the characteristic appearance seen due to a spiculated periosteal lifting reaction due to an aggressive bone tumor that forms a Codman triangle?
Which of the following bone tumors has a 'soap bubble' appearance on X-ray?
An osteoblastic metastasis is most likely to occur from which of the following malignancies?
Which of these metastatic bone tumors shows up as a solitary unifocal lesion?

A 20-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of localized, dull, aching pain of the right tibia, particularly at night, and is relieved with aspirin. He has no history of trauma. X-ray shows a radiolucent nidus with a rim of reactive bone around the diaphysis of the proximal tibia. What is the most likely benign tumor that causes nocturnal pain in this patient?
Which congenital formation is characterized by the formation of rudimentary limbs?
Which tumor is associated with a translocation of t(11:22)?

answers.option: Giant cell tumour of the bone

question: What is the most common diaphyseal tumor?

answers.option: Giant cell tumour of the bone

question: What is the condition of fibrosis in lungs in coal miners called?
What is the route for the spread of tuberculosis to the spine?
What is the cause of caisson's disease?

answers.option: Air embolism due to pressure change
It is characterized by pulmonary insufficiency, neurologic symptoms, anemia, and thrombocytopenia
It is an ominous complication of labor and the immediate postpartum period

question: Which malignancy is associated with asbestosis?

A patient presents to the outpatient department for the evaluation of his dwarfism. On examination, he has short limbs and a relatively large head. The father also had the same condition. What is your most probable diagnosis?

An elderly man presents to the clinic with a large painful mass in his shoulder. Biopsy shows anaplastic chondrocytes and hyaline cartilage matrix. Which of the following statements is true regarding this lesion?

answers.option: High grade lesions favor lymphatic spread
Most low grade lesions show anaplasia and abnormal mitoses
Some of its variants are clear cell and mesenchymal

question: When is osteoarthritis referred as a primary disorder?

answers.option: Occurs as a consequence of some other disease

question: Marie-Strumpell disease is an another name for which type of arthritis?
What is the origin of osteoblastic metastases to bone?
What is the most common type of joint disease in the body?
Which of the following sites is affected by osteosarcoma?
What is the most common site of osteosarcoma?
Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding chondroblastoma?

answers.option: On morphology, it shows circumscribed, pericellular calcification
It involves the age group of 10–20 years
It involves the age group of 40-50 years
It involves epiphysis of long bones
It is a benign, cartilage forming primary tumor

question: A 6-year-old came with short stature below the 3rd percentile. His family has short stature from his father's side. He has frontal bossing, depressed nasal bridge, rhizomelia of lower limbs, and has frequent ear infections. He is also found to have kyphosis. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following terms best defines a sequestrum?

A 35-year-old male presents to the clinic with bone pain and fever. A presumptive diagnosis of osteomyelitis is made. Culture reveals the presence of gram-negative diplococci. What is the most likely causative organism?
A 9-year-old child is brought to the clinic with pain in the right leg associated with swelling. X-ray reveals evidence of Brodie's abscess. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Impairment in the function of which of the following cell types results in osteopetrosis?

A 20-years old male presented to the clinic with history of pain and swelling along medial aspect of right knee. There is no history of trauma. X-ray shows a pedunculated bony outgrowth from metaphysis of distal femur pointing away from the joint. What is most likely pedunculated benign tumor that caused this swelling?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with a complaint of dull hip pain for 3 years. On investigation, there is a mass of 10 cm × 13 cm attached to the hips which has irregular borders. Removal of the mass from ischium for biopsy reveals spotty calcifications. The transverse section of the mass reveals a blue-gray color. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A female G2 P1 presents to the clinic in the 21st week of gestation as she is not feeling fetal movements. On investigation, the fetus seems short-statured. The fetus is delivered at the 28th week of gestation as a stillborn baby and is noticed to have blue sclerae. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following tumors arises from the diaphysis of bone?

A 30-year-old male was presented in a clinic with a suspected bone tumor epiphysis of the proximal tibia. X-ray shows an eccentric lytic area, giving a "soap bubble" involving appearance. Which of the following benign tumors has a hallmark of a soap bubble appearance?
A 20-year-old female presents with swelling right proximal tibia. X-ray shows a sunburst-appearance osteoblastic lesion in the proximal tibia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A baby dies in utero due to multiple fractures. What is the most likely mutation causing this condition?

A 45-year-old man presented to the emergency department with complaints of back pain that had been present for six months. He reported that the pain was worse when at rest and improved with activity. In addition to the back pain, he complained of redness in his left eye. After an investigation, he was diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitis. Which of the following gene is associated with ankylosing spondylitis?

A 16-year-old girl is noted to be developing an odd, twisted appearance to her back for the past 3 years. On examination, she is tall and thin. A radiograph reveals an abnormal lateral bowing of the spine, with 20 degrees of lateral curvature in the mid-thoracic region. Which of the following is most likely to produce these findings?

answers.option: Multiple osteochondromas of the vertebral bodies
Disorder of procollagen synthesis with multiple compressed fractures
Repeated episodes of blunt force trauma to the torso
Asymmetric cartilage growth of vertebral body end plates

question: Which of the following statements is true regarding sequestrum formation in the course of osteomyelitis?

answers.option: It is formed as a result of deposition of new bone
It is formed as a result of necrosis
It is formed as a result of destruction of hyaline cartilage
It is formed as a result of intraosseous abscess
It is formed as a result of apoptosis

question: An X-ray pelvis anteroposterior view of a young female demonstrated bilateral symmetrical transverse lucent bands oriented at right angles to the cortex involving the neck of the femur. These lucent lines do not extend across the full width of the femur. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following diseases is characterized by a progressive erosion of articular cartilage?
What is the triggering factor in osteitis deformans?

A 70-year-old obese male presents to the clinic with complaints of joint pain and morning stiffness that worsens with movement. On examination, there are bumps on his fingers. On radiological imaging, osteophytes and subchondral cysts are noted. The amount of cartilage in joints is reduced. Which of the following diseases is also associated with a reduced amount of cartilage in joints?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the morphology of chondroblastoma?

answers.option: Sheets of primitive small round cells
Cortical, interlacing micro trabeculae of woven bone
Collagenous to myxoid matrix, stellate cells

question: Which one of the following is a feature of osteoarthritis on an x-ray?

A 40-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a history of severe pain in the right knee joint along with fever and chills. On examination, the joint is hot, tender, and swollen. Joint fluid analysis showed WBC 50,000/dL. What will be the most probable diagnosis?
Corneal clouding can be seen in which of the following?

answers.option: Hurler mucopolysaccharidosis and Hunter mucopolysaccharidosis both

question: Which of the following statements regarding osteosarcoma is correct?

answers.option: It is attached to the underlying skeleton by a bony stalk
It is most common before 15 years of age
It is characterized by low levels of alkaline phosphatase

question: Which of the following refers to the lateral deviation of the big toe of the right foot?
What is the origin of the most common primary bone tumor?
Which of the following is the serum marker for increased osteoblastic activity?
Which of the following is not a long term complication of osteomyelitis?
Which of the following joints is most frequently and severely involved in rheumatoid arthritis?
Which of the following is not a feature of osteoarthritis?
Which tumor is common in the epiphysis region?

A 38-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of back pain for 3 years. There is no history of skin lesions or inflammatory bowel disease. On X-ray, there is involvement of the sacroiliac joint. What is the probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most common skeletal dysplasia?
“Brittle bone disease” is a name given to which of the following skeletal dysplasias?
Which of the following antibodies found in dermatomyositis are associated with interstitial lung disease, non-erosive arthritis, and mechanic’s hand?
Which of the following features is not a characteristic of osteopetrosis?
Which of the following is the serum marker that indicates increased osteoclastic activity?
How many days are required for an uncalcified osteoid matrix to be mineralized?
What is the classic appearance of synovial sarcoma?

A patient with rheumatoid arthritis presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of radial deviation of the wrist and ulnar deviation of fingers with flexion and hyperextension of fingers. What is this deformity called?

A middle-aged man presents to the clinic with cataracts, endocrinopathy, and cardiomyopathy. He also complains that he has sustained involuntary muscular contractions occasionally. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is a feature of cleidocranial dysplasia?

A 29-year-old woman gave birth to a baby who was small for gestational age (<5th percentile). Some time later he is brought to the clinic due to growth abnormalities. On examination, the child has a normal torso and head size, short extremities, and bowing of long bones. However, there is no osteopenia. There is also no disturbance of activities in his daily life after necessary changes in the house and school. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A middle-aged woman presents to the outpatient department with complaints of fluctuating muscle weakness, diplopia, and drooping of upper eyelids. The muscle weakness worsens throughout the day. Electromyography shows decreased muscle activity after repeated stimulations. Which of the following conditions is associated with thymic abnormality?
What is the name given to dead bone in osteomyelitis?

A child had hepatosplenomegaly, anemia, and thick, sclerotic bones with flat, deformed metaphyses. He was diagnosed with osteopetrosis. The function of which of the following cells is impaired in osteopetrosis?
A child has hepatosplenomegaly, anemia, multiple fractures, and cranial nerve deficits. Radiography reveals thick, sclerotic bones with flat, deformed metaphyses. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Parathyroid hormone has a role in the synthesis of active vitamin D3. Which of the following enzymes is activated by the parathyroid hormone?
Where is osteosarcoma most commonly found?
A surgeon finds a mass in the diaphysis of a young child. Which radiological feature will favor the diagnosis of a malignant tumor over a benign one?

A 13-year-old boy who was previously healthy has had pain in his right leg for the past month. There is no history of trauma or recent illness. A radiograph of the right leg shows a 6-cm expansile mass in the diaphyseal region of the right lower femur that extends into the soft tissue and is covered by layers of reactive bone. A biopsy of the mass is done, and microscopic examination shows sheets of closely packed, primitive cells with small, uniform nuclei and only scant cytoplasm. Karyotypic analysis of the tumor cells shows a t(11:22) translocation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

In the absence of parathyroid hormone receptor binding on osteoclasts, which factor produced by osteoblasts binds to osteoclast precursor cells and promotes their differentiation into mature osteoclasts?

A middle-aged man presents to the outpatient department with complaints of burning micturition and joint pain. Culture shows the presence of gram-negative diplococci. What is the most likely causative organism?
Which of the following organisms is most commonly responsible for causing osteomyelitis?

A 48-year-old female presents with low-grade fever, small joint pain, and morning stiffness lasting 30-40 minutes for 6 months. She is diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. Which test is specific for rheumatoid arthritis?
A 50-year-old obese male with a history of hypertension presents with swelling and pain in the right metatarsophalangeal joint. You suspect gout. Which of the following is a feature of acute gout?

answers.option: Positively birefringent crystals on polarized light
Negatively birefringent crystals on polarized light
